class.name: AttributeBase
class.description:
This is an abstract base class for Attributes. You should not use this class directly, but rather use one of its derived classes. A good practice consists of overriding the [Attribute] class to create your own attributes.
In certain scenarios, you could also create attributes from other [Attribute] classes by overriding three methods: â€” [method _compute_value] Handles value computation. - [method _derived_from] Subscribes to some attributes that will define how this attribute is derived. Like strength and dexterity on a damage attribute.

method.name: _compute_value
method.description: Computes the value of the attribute. [codeblock] [gdscript] func _compute_value(argument: AttributeComputationArgument) -> Array: return clampf(argument.operated_value, 0, 100.0) [/gdscript] [/codeblock]

method.name: _derived_from
method.description: Subscribes to some attributes that will define how this attribute is derived. Like strength and dexterity on a damage attribute. [codeblock] [gdscript] func _derived_from(attribute_set: AttributeSet) -> Array: return [ attribute_set.find_attribute_by_name("MyAttributeName_1"), attribute_set.find_attribute_by_name("MyAttributeName_2") ] [/gdscript] [/codeblock]
